title: Intra-doc links are not resolved in inherited docs from upstream traits

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-intra-doc-links
labels.description: Area: Intra-doc links, the ability to link to items in docs by name

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

There are two crates, `outer` and `inner`. `outer` depends on `inner`.

outer/src/lib.rs:
```rust
use inner::SomeTrait;

pub struct SomeStruct;

impl SomeTrait for SomeStruct {
    fn foo() {}
}
```

outer/inner/src/lib.rs:
```rust
/// this is a trait
pub trait SomeTrait {
    /// this is a method for [SomeTrait]
    fn foo();
}

pub mod bar {
    use super::SomeTrait;

    pub struct BarStruct;

    impl SomeTrait for BarStruct {
        fn foo() {}
    }
}
```

I expected to see this happen: The trait implementation docs for `SomeTrait::foo` on `outer::SomeStruct` link to `SomeTrait`.

Instead, this happened: The link is not resolved, and there is no warning or indication that it failed. Here is a screenshot of the generated docs:

![foo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1372438/85938535-39c8d380-b8dc-11ea-9352-863a7cae9196.png)

Notably, the docs on `inner::bar::BarStruct` resolve correctly despite being in a different module, indicating that this is a cross-crate issue.
